p: Except for S. tomentosa, slope grade significantly affected the distribution of seven dominant species ( p ≤ 0.05) ( Table 3 and Figure 3). Among the eight species, R. chrysanthum had the largest abundance across all slope grades ( Figure 3) and were mainly distributed on slopes below 35°. The distribution of V. uliginosum concentrated on slopes below 5°. However, the majority of the herbs concentrated on steep slopes (above 35°) ( Figure 3).
